page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO GT EASTON
page.content: In our 12 square km, most of the area is arable farmland with a few small herds of cattle.The land is made up of heavy fertile soil, overlaying London clay, making it hard to drain and there are many springs.There are 2 villages.The main one is Great Easton.This has a very old church which was built in 983.There is a primary school to which most local children go.Although the villages are small the roads are fairly busy. There are only a few business's in Gt. Easton and they are quite small.Most of the population live here and in the smaller village of Duton Hill.Nearby at Tilty is another very old church which used to be at the gates of a great Abbey where the common villagers could worship God.Now there is just the church,Abbey ruins and one house.
